explains: n. 日食，月食；黯然失色；羽毛暗淡期；消失，丧失
v. 遮住……的光，使黯然失色
wordGroup: partial eclipse n. 偏食，日偏食
eclipse of the moon 月食
eclipse of the sun 日食
annular eclipse [天文学]日环食；[天文学]环蚀

sentences.en: A total solar eclipse is due to take place some time tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 预计日全食会出现在明天的某个时候。

sentences.en: An eclipse happens when the earth and moon are in line with the sun.
sentences.cn: 地球和月亮与太阳处在一条直线上，日食就发生了。

sentences.en: Mo did not want to be ruled by anyone and it is notable that she never allowed the men in her life to eclipse her.
sentences.cn: 莫不想被任何人管制，很显然，她从不允许她生活中的男性使她黯然失色。
